article_title: Local tax preparers are bracing for a late rush
article_text:
Local tax preparers are bracing for a late rush Americans' uncertainty about how Affordable Care Act affects them has many 'taking their time' about filing returns

Photo: James Nielsen, Staff Van Young, who lives in the Tomball area, has his taxes filed... The Affordable Care Act could be driving more procrastinators to tax preparers in Houston during this year's deadline rush.

article_metadata.description: Americans' uncertainty about how Affordable Care Act affects them has many 'taking their time' about filing returns  [...] Martin said, taxpayers would have to repay some of the credit if they reported a $30,000 annual salary when enrolling for insurance but ended up earning $40,000 for the year.  Or if they reported four people living in their house and then had one person move out.  H&R Block found that, nationwide, 52 percent of its customers enrolled in state or federal marketplaces had to pay back a portion of the credit designed to lower the cost of health insurance.  The average amount paid back was $530, which decreased individual tax refunds by an average of 17 percent.  Cindy Alam, who manages 34 Jackson Hewitt Tax Services in the greater Houston area, said this complexity caused by the Affordable Care Act is bringing in new customers.
article_metadata.author.name: By Andrea Rumbaugh
